company.name: Metropolitan Home Mortgage, Inc.
company.business_description: Metropolitan Home Mortgage, Inc., doing business as Wholesale Home Lenders, is a for-profit corporation that operates in the mortgage lending industry and is subject to the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

case_info.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; and the Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 642

complaint.factual_background: Metropolitan Home Mortgage, Inc. sent prescreened mortgage solicitations to consumers from January 2006 to January 2008 that violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act's Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule. The solicitations failed to provide required disclosures about consumers' right to opt out of receiving prescreened offers in the proper format, type size, and manner required by federal regulations. These violations constituted a knowing pattern or practice of non-compliance with FCRA disclosure requirements.

representations_made.description: Defendant sent prescreened solicitations that purported to comply with FCRA disclosure requirements
representations_made.quoted_text: Defendant markets mortgage products by making firm offers of credit through solicitations sent to consumers who have been prescreened.

counts.title: Violations of FCRA Prescreen Disclosure Requirements
counts.representation: Defendant sent prescreened solicitations to consumers that purportedly contained the required opt-out disclosures as mandated by Section 615(d) of the FCRA and the Prescreen Rule
counts.fact: From at least January 2006 to January 2008, the solicitations: (a) did not contain a short notice on the front page; (b) contained opt-out information that was not in a distinct type style or larger type size than the principal text; (c) contained a long notice that was in a type size smaller than the principal text, was not in a distinct type style, was not set apart from other text, and/or did not include the prescribed heading
counts.conclusion: By and through these acts and practices, Defendant has violated section 615(d)(2) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §1681m(d)(2), and section 642.3 of the Prescreen Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 642.3, which also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

definitions.Defendant: Metropolitan Home Mortgage, Inc. ("Metropolitan"), also doing business as Wholesale Home Lenders ("Wholesale"), and its successors and assigns.
definitions.FCRA and Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule d: The definitions set forth in the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681a, et seq, and the Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 642, shall apply.

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $20,000 to the United States pursuant to section 621(a) of the FCRA.

requirements.description: Pay $20,000 civil penalty by electronic fund transfer or cashier's check
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant shall pay to Plaintiff, pursuant to section 621(a) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a), a civil penalty in the amount of Twenty Thousand Dollars ($20,000)

requirements.description: Make payment within 10 business days of entry of Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant shall make this payment within ten (10) business days of the date of entry of this Order by electronic f-and transfer or cashier's check in accordance with instructions provided by the. Office of Consumer Litigation, Civil Division, U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, D.C. 20530, for appropriate disposition.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to comply with the Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule in connection with making any firm offer of credit or insurance.

requirements.description: Must comply with Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 642) when making firm offers of credit or insurance
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order by personal service or otherwise, whether acting directly or through any business entity, corporation, subsidiary, division, affiliate, or other device, in connection with the making of any "firm offer of credit or insurance" as that term is defined in section 603(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a(1), are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to comply with the Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 642, which establishes the format, type size, and manner of the notices to consumers requJ.re.d pursuant to section 6!5(d) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C~ § 168Ira(d), informing consumers of their, right to opt out of having their consumer report information used to send them unsolicited offers of credit or insurmace.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Commission is authorized to monitor and investigate compliance with the Order through various means including written reports, document production, depositions, and business inspections.

requirements.description: Submit additional written reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, and provide entry to business locations upon written notice from Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of wriRen notice from a representative of the Commission, Defendant shall submit additional written reports, which are true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury; produce documents for inspection and copying; appear for deposition; and/or provide entry during normal business hours to any business location in Defendant's possession or direct or indirect control to inspect the business operation;

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to interview employees, consultants, contractors, representatives, or agents
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant shall permit representatives of the Commission to interview any employer, consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview, relating in any way to any conduct subject to this Order. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the Commission of business structure changes and provide periodic compliance reports for five years.

requirements.description: Notify Commission of any change in business structure or ownership at least 30 days prior to such change (or as soon as practicable if less than 30 days' notice)
requirements.quoted_text: For a period of five (5) years from the date of entry of this Order, Defendant shall notify the Commission of any change in structure or any business entity that Defendant directly or indirectly controls, or has an ownership interest in, that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including but not limited to: incorporation or other organization; a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent~ or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order; or a change in the business name or address, at least thirty (30) days prior to such change, provided that, with. respect to any proposed change in the business entity about which Defendant learns less than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, such Defendant shall notify the Commission as soon as practicable after obtaining such lmowledge.

requirements.description: Provide initial written compliance report 180 days after entry of Order and annually thereafter for five years
requirements.quoted_text: One hundred eighty (180) days after thedate of entry of this Order and annually thereafter for a period of five (5) years, Defendant shall provide a written report to the FTC, which is true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which they have complied and are complying with this Order.

requirements.description: Notify Commission of bankruptcy filing within 15 days
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant shall notify the Commission of the filing of a banh'uptcy petition by such Defendant within fifteen (15) days of filing.

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specific records for eight years, including copies of prescreened solicitations, written procedures, and compliance documents.

requirements.description: Create and retain copies of each prescreened solicitation and related promotional materials sent to consumers
requirements.quoted_text: A copy of each separate and materially distinct written prescreened solicitation sent to consumers and any related promotional materials sent to consumers,

requirements.description: Create and retain written procedures to ensure consumers who opted out will not receive prescreened solicitations
requirements.quoted_text: Written Wocedure.s to ensure that consumers who have opted out of receiving prescreened solicitations will not receive prescreened solicitations,

requirements.description: Create and retain all records demonstrating full compliance with the Order, including acknowledgments and FTC reports
requirements.quoted_text: All records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including but not limited to, copies of acknowledgments of receipt of this Order required by the Sections titled "Distribution of Order" and "Acknowledgement of Receipt of Order" and all reports submitted to the FTC pursuant to the Section rifled "Compliance Reporting."

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees for five years.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to current principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees within 5 days of service
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to (1) all of its principals, officers, directors, and managers; (2) all of its employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter of this Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Subsection A of the Section tiffed "Compliance Reporting." For current personnel, delivery shall be within five (5) days of service of this Order upon Defendant.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to new personnel prior to assuming responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: For new personnel, delivery shall occur prior to them assuming their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to any business entity resulting from change in structure at least 10 days prior to change
requirements.quoted_text: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Subsection A oft.he Section titled "Compliance Reporting," delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure.

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from all persons receiving the Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the Order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, fi:om al! persons receiving a copy of the Order pursuant to this Section.

provisions.title: Acknowledgement of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days.

requirements.description: Submit truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant, within five (5) business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over the matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, .and enforcement of ttiis Order.

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party bears its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

requirements.description: Each party bears its own costs and attorneys' fees
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred ha connection with this action.

duration.termination_text: This is a federal court consent decree with indefinite duration. The Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement. Specific provisions have time-limited obligations: compliance reporting and distribution of order obligations last 5 years; recordkeeping obligations last 8 years. The permanent injunction (Provision II) has no termination date.
